Posts.Content: Nov 17, 2008 09:31AM - edited Nov 17, 2008 09:32AM by sammie08 Hi again everyone!Good thoughts to all on this Monday morning. Just checking in again before my Dec 1 appoint.I know I read over and over on here that the waiting is the hardest.Well it certainly is.I don't know if my imagination has gotten the best of me ......I don't really sleep because I am so worried and I don't know if I am dreaming up more symtoms or if it is something more to be worried about. I'm starting to feel achey in and around the breast that has the lump,and this kind thobbing griggly(sp?)(like the stomach griggles) on the lump. My husband felt the lump again last night(I feel a dull pain when the lump is pressed on) and he says it feels fiborious and like chicken breast.When I feel it I just get confused. Like I've said I already stuggle with anxiety and I do believe it is pretty powerful and might be making me fell some imaginary things but I don't know for sure.I really wish I could get in sooner it is so frustarating. Any thoughts at this point are welcome,thank you :-)
Posts.Title: Very worried,please help sammie08 sammie08

Posts.Content: sammie08 wrote: This is my orginal post http://community.breastcancer.org/forum/83/topic/724315 So I had my doctor appt on Dec 1 and she did a very good exam and didn't see anything abnormal and did not feel an unusal lump where I have been feeling it and feeling pain on and off.The exam was on one of the last days of my cycle . I have I bilatiral mammo and US tommarow and I am very scared.I'm mainly scared now because of this on and off pain I am feeling where I've felt a lump.The pain has gotten worse and it no longer seems to be related to my cycle. It is like a tingling almost burning pain in that part of my right breast when touched  or or pressure is put on it. I know I'll probably have some answers soon enough. You ladies on here are so positive and supportive on this board.Any input on this update would be so apperciated on this day before my first mammo/US . Thanks Sammie Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Update sammie08 sammie08

Posts.Content: sammie08 wrote: Hi, I'm a 41 year old mother of 2. I have VERY questionable health insurance and I can't get in the see a doctor until January.I'm also terrified to go to the doctor as I don't have a regular doctor and have no idea who is good or who I can trust.I have paralazing anxiety about going to a doctor. Here is my worry.I noticed a lump in my right breast about 2 months ago but it seemed to go away after my cycle.Now towards the end of my last cycle(a week ago) I started noticing it again.It is still here but doesn't seem to be as big as it was two months ago.I've been doing research online and one site mentioned that it could be danger if the blood vessels are more pronounced on one breast(more than the other) and the vessels on my right are somewhat more pronounced on my right side.I've also read about puckering and skin looking like a orange.I'm confused about this I suppose that when I'm cold they do look kinda strange but my husband dosn't think so.My nipples don't go inward and I have no discharge. Should I be this worried?If I do indeed have puckering orange peel looking areola and it is cancer,how far along could it be?It always says that symptoms such as this don't show up until the cancer is more advanced.How adavanced?I feel doomed I'm so scared!Any words of comfort from anyone?Thank you in advance Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Nov 12, 2008 10:22PM sammie08 wrote: Thank you so much for your replies everyone.What great words from all and wonderful support.I do feel better. I got a closer doctor's appt. to Dec.1.I'm still terrified to go and scared about the whole insurance thing.This anxiety is the worst.I do make myself just sick. I'll be in touch.Hugs and prayers to everyone whatever your situation.:) Any futher input is always appercaited.
Posts.Title: Very worried,please help sammie08 sammie08

Posts.Content: Dec 8, 2008 08:20PM sammie08 wrote: Well, I had the mammo and US today and since I was having some pain and a lump(that seems to change in size) the doctor looked at both reports right away.I'm so lucky. The doctor said that nothing looked worrisome at all,I have some small cysts and to come back in a year for an annual mammo.The negative results will be sent to my primary. I am in shock with happiness,I couldn't even ask the questions that I needed to ask.I expected at least a few complications.I will ask my primary those questions about my report. Thank you all for all the support and encouragement to get this checked!Hugs and blessings to everyone!
